ai.summary: Fir Long Loop is an 11.9 km moderate circular hike in the UK, offering a varied route that combines woodland trails with gentle climbs and open sections for occasional scenic views.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features a varied mix of well-trodden forest paths, grassy clearings, and intermittent ascents. Expect uneven footing, tree roots, and occasional muddy patches after rain, with occasional open sections that provide exposure to the wind and views.
ai.safety_notes: Plan around daylight; check the forecast and potential for muddy conditions. Wear sturdy boots and bring layers. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a whistle. Inform someone of your plan and expected return. Stay on marked paths, watch for low branches, and be cautious on uneven ground and river crossings if present.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers (jacket, hat, gloves as needed)
Map or GPS device and compass
Light rain shell or waterproof layer
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly April to October)

seo.title: Fir Long Loop – 11.9 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Fir Long Loop, an 11.9 km moderate circular hike in the UK. Varied woodland terrain, manageable climbs, and scenic views make it ideal for a day outdoors.
